<< bitxor Operators colon >>

cat

Concatenate arrays.

Syntax

R = cat(dim, A, B)
R = cat(dim, A1, A2, ..., An)

Input argument

dim

Dimension to operate along: positive integer scalar.

A

a variable: first input.

B

a variable: second input.

A1, A2, ..., An

List of inputs to concatenate

Output argument

R

concatenated array

Description

R = cat(dim, M1, M2, ... , MN) returns the concatenation of M1, M2, ... , MN along the dimension dim.

Example

A = eye(2, 2);
B = ones(2, 2);
C = cat(2, A, B)

See also

vertcat, horzcat.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
